translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Sihāsani
They had gone for refuge to the Buddha,
and had faith in the Realised One.
All of them gathered together and discussed,
making a garland for the Teacher;
Not being able to get a single pillar,
they searched in the Great Wood.
I approached the group at that time;
Raising my hands in respectful salutation,
but a single pillar is not available.
and I will give it to the Teacher;

original: appossukkā bhavantu te.🔽Te me thambhaṁ pavecchiṁsu,
analyzed: appossukkāḥ bhavantu te  te me thambham
translated: may you be free from anxiety.”🔽They, being satisfied and delighted in mind,
they went to their own homes.
Not long after the group had gone,
I took the pillar at that time;
Through that confidence in my mind,
I was reborn in a divine mansion;
I was the king named Yaso.

analyzed: yam yam yonupapajjāmi  devattam atha mānusa
translated: Whatever womb I entered,🔽whether divine or human;
the fruit of the single pillar.
when I gave the pillar then;
I do not recall any bad destination,
the fruit of the single pillar.
The six super-knowledges have been realized,
the Buddha's instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ekatthambhiko thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai ekatthambhikaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable Ekatthambhika told this verse.
The Story of the Elder Ekatthambhika is finished.
